The Planets

Click on the image above to explore each planet in our Solar System!

The Sun

The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System.

Know More about The Sun

Mercury

Mercury is the smallest planet in our Solar System and closest to the Sun.

Know More about The Mercury

Venus

Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the hottest planet.

Know More about The Venus

Earth

Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known planet with life.

Know More about The Earth

Mars

Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and known as the Red Planet.

Know More about The Mars

Jupiter

Jupiter is the largest planet in our Solar System and has a giant red spot.

Know More about The Jupiter

Saturn

Saturn is known for its beautiful ring system made of ice and rock.

Know More about The Saturn

Uranus

Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and has a unique sideways rotation.

Know More about The Uranus

Neptune

Neptune is the eighth planet from the Sun and has strong winds and storms.

Know More about The Neptune

Pluto (Dwarf Planet)

Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt, known for its highly elliptical orbit and former status as the ninth planet.

Know More about Pluto

Moon (Earth's Natural Satellite)

The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and plays a crucial role in regulating tides and stabilizing Earth's rotation.

Know More about the Moon
